alert.note: Alert for Grays Harbor (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 06 at 8:34PM PST until January 08 at 3:45AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Seattle WA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Washington... Satsop River Near Satsop affecting Grays Harbor County. .Heavy rain over the Southwest Interior and Olympics Thursday into early Friday morning will push the Satsop River near Satsop above flood stage. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Satsop River Near Satsop. * WHEN...Until early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 38.0 feet, the Satsop River will flood low pasture lands and some roads along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 PM PST Thursday the stage was 36.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late Thursday evening to a crest of 39.7 feet late Friday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Friday evening. - Flood stage is 38.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Friday morning at 700 AM PST.
